1.text: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

2.text: Who is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge?

3.text: Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.

4.text: Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare, if thou hast understanding.

5.text: Who determined the measures thereof, if thou knowest? or who stretched the line upon it?

6.text: Whereupon were the foundations thereof fastened? or who laid the corner stone thereof;

7.text: When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?

8.text: Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it brake forth, as if it had issued out of the womb;

9.text: When I made the cloud the garment thereof, and thick darkness a swaddlingband for it,

10.text: And prescribed for it my decree, and set bars and doors,

11.text: And said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further; and here shall thy proud waves be stayed?

12.text: Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days began, and caused the dayspring to know its place;

13.text: That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, and the wicked be shaken out of it?

14.text: It is changed as clay under the seal; and all things stand forth as a garment:

15.text: And from the wicked their light is withholden, and the high arm is broken.

16.text: Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? or hast thou walked in the recesses of the deep?

17.text: Have the gates of death been revealed unto thee? or hast thou seen the gates of the shadow of death?

18.text: Hast thou comprehended the breadth of the earth? declare, if thou knowest it all.

19.text: Where is the way to the dwelling of light, and as for darkness, where is the place thereof;

20.text: That thou shouldest take it to the bound thereof, and that thou shouldest discern the paths to the house thereof?

21.text: Doubtless, thou knowest, for thou wast then born, and the number of thy days is great!

22.text: Hast thou entered the treasuries of the snow, or hast thou seen the treasuries of the hail,

23.text: Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?

24.text: By what way is the light parted, or the east wind scattered upon the earth?

25.text: Who hath cleft a channel for the waterflood, or a way for the lightning of the thunder;

26.text: To cause it to rain on a land where no man is; on the wilderness, wherein there is no man;

27.text: To satisfy the waste and desolate ground; and to cause the tender grass to spring forth?

28.text: Hath the rain a father? or who hath begotten the drops of dew?

29.text: Out of whose womb came the ice? and the hoary frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?

30.text: The waters are hidden as with stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.

31.text: Canst thou bind the cluster of the Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?

32.text: Canst thou lead forth the Mazzaroth in their season? or canst thou guide the Bear with her train?

33.text: Knowest thou the ordinances of the heavens? canst thou establish the dominion thereof in the earth?

34.text: Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?

35.text: Canst thou send forth lightnings, that they may go, and say unto thee, Here we are?

36.text: Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts? or who hath given understanding to the mind?

37.text: Who can number the clouds by wisdom? or who can pour out the bottles of heaven,

38.text: When the dust runneth into a mass, and the clods cleave fast together?

39.text: Wilt thou hunt the prey for the lioness? or satisfy the appetite of the young lions,

40.text: When they couch in their dens, and abide in the covert to lie in wait?

41.text: Who provideth for the raven his food, when his young ones cry unto God, and wander for lack of meat?
